clusters.title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader who ran for president, dies at age 84

items.title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader who ran for president, dies at age 84
items.standfirst: The Rev. Jesse Jackson marched alongside Martin Luther King Jr., ran for president in the 1980s and led the Rainbow/PUSH Coalition in Chicago for decades.
items.content: The Rev. Jesse Jackson marched alongside Martin Luther King Jr., ran for president in the 1980s and led the Rainbow/PUSH Coalition in Chicago for decades.

items.title: Veteran US civil rights activist Jesse Jackson dies aged 84
items.standfirst: Veteran US civil rights activist Reverend Jesse Jackson, one of the nation's most influential Black voices, died peacefully Tuesday morning, his family said in a statement. He was 84. Jackson, a Baptist minister, had been a civil rights leader since the 1960s, when he marched with Martin Luther King Jr. and helped fundraise for the cause.
items.content: Veteran US civil rights activist Reverend Jesse Jackson, one of the nation's most influential Black voices, died peacefully Tuesday morning, his family said in a statement. He was 84. Jackson, a Baptist minister, had been a civil rights leader since the 1960s, when he marched with Martin Luther King Jr. and helped fundraise for the cause.

items.title: Longtime civil rights leader Rev. Jesse Jackson dies at 84
items.standfirst: The Rev. Jesse Jackson was a lifelong civil rights advocate until his death Tuesday at the age of 84.
items.content: The Rev. Jesse Jackson was a lifelong civil rights advocate until his death Tuesday at the age of 84.(Image credit: Jason Mendez)

items.title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader, dies aged 84
items.standfirst: A fixture in civil rights and Democratic politics since the 1960s, Jackson was once close to Martin Luther King JrJesse Jackson dies – latest updatesThe Rev Jesse Jackson, the civil rights campaigner who was prominent for more than 50 years and who ran strongly for the Democratic presidential nomination in 1988, has died. He was 84.“Our father was a servant leader – not only to our family, but to the oppressed, the voiceless, and the overlooked around the world,” the Jackson family said in a statement. Continue reading...
items.content: A fixture in civil rights and Democratic politics since the 1960s, Jackson was once close to Martin Luther King JrJesse Jackson dies – latest updatesThe Rev Jesse Jackson, the civil rights campaigner who was prominent for more than 50 years and who ran strongly for the Democratic presidential nomination in 1988, has died. He was 84.“Our father was a servant leader – not only to our family, but to the oppressed, the voiceless, and the overlooked around the world,” the Jackson family said in a statement. items.title: ‘Get the files out’: Hillary Clinton slams Trump's Epstein cover-up
items.standfirst: Former US secretary of state Hillary Clinton accused President Donald Trump of staging a "cover-up" over files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Days before her scheduled deposition before a Congressional committee, Clinton said the Republicans probing her are trying to deflect attention away from President Donald Trump, whose name is also mentioned in the files.
items.content: Former US secretary of state Hillary Clinton accused President Donald Trump of staging a "cover-up" over files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
